summary: Experienced Siemens MRI Application Specialist with a demonstrated history of working in the hospital & health care industry. Skilled in Magnetic Resonance, X-ray, Medical Devices, Healthcare Information Technology (HIT), Picture Archiving and Communication System (PACS), and Digital Imaging. Strong information technology professional with a Master's Degree focused in Magnetic Resonance Imaging (MRI) from Anglia Ruskin University. Currently working as a Global MRI application Specialist for Siemens also holding the position of clinical applications manager at Sultan United Medical Company ( Partner of Siemens healthcare) Kuwait.

publications.description: The purpose of this study was to compare the properties of the median nerve and the flexor retinaculum within the carpal tunnel with Magnetic Resonance Imaging (MRI) under two conditions: (a) fingers extended, and (b) fingers in an isometric squeeze grip.
publications.name: Finger Position Alters the Median Nerve Properties within the Carpal Tunnel: A Pre-Post MRI Comparison Study.

publications.description:
PURPOSE
 
To measure the apparent diffusion coefficient (ADC) values of various  
focal liver lesions (FLLs) on a 3 T MRI unit using single shot EPI 
diffusion weighted sequences.
publications.name: A study of diffusion weighted MR imaging of focal liver lesions in 3 Tesla MR system

publications.description: PURPOSE To evaluate the differences in the ADC values of various focal liver lesions (FLLs) between 1.5 T and 3 T MRI units using single shot  echo planar imaging (EPI) diffusion weighted (DW) sequences.
publications.name: A comparative study of diffusion weighted MR imaging of focal liver lesions in 1.5 and 3 Tesla MR systems
"A comparative study of diffusion weighted imaging of liver pathologies in 1.5 tesla and 3 tesla MR systems"
publications.description: Masters Thesis Submitted to Anglia Ruskin University

Magnetic resonance angiographic evaluation of the intracranial vasculature has been predominantly carried out using conventional angiographic techniques such as time of flight and phase contrast sequences. These techniques have good spatial resolution but lack temporal resolution. Newer faster angiographic techniques have been developed to circumvent this limitation. Elliptical centric time-resolved imaging of contrast kinetics (EC-TRICKS) is one such technique which has combined the use of elliptical centric ordering of the k-space with multiphase 3D digital subtraction MR angiogram (MRA) to achieve excellent temporal resolution of the arterial and venous circulations. Its applications have been mainly in the peripheral vasculature. We report the use of this technique in a case of a high-flow, direct carotid-cavernous fistula to demonstrate its potential in intracranial MR angiography.
publications.name: Magnetic resonance angiographic demonstration of carotid-cavernous fistula using elliptical centric time resolved imaging of contrast kinetics (EC-TRICKS)

publications.description: Research Conducted with B Sc Radiology students from Kuwait University

Previous and more recent work of analyzing structural changes in the brain suggest that certain brain regions such as the frontal lobe are among the brain regions profoundly affected by the aging process across males and females. Also, a unified model of structural changes in a normally aging brain is still lacking. The present study investigated age-related structural brain changes in gray matter from young to early middle-age adulthood for males and females by using Magnetic Resonance Imaging.
publications.name: A voxel-based morphometric magnetic resonance imaging study of the brain detects age-related gray matter volume changes in healthy subjects of 21–45 years old
